greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = phi(n) * core(n), where phi is Euler totient function, and core gives the squarefree part of n.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants II, Encyclopedia of Mathematics and Its Applications, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 2018, p. 161.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
Chantal David and Francesco Pappalardi, Average Frobenius distributions of elliptic curves, International Mathematics Research Notices, Vol. 1999, No. 4 (1999), pp. 165-183, alternative link.
mathematica: Array[EulerPhi[#] (Sqrt@ # /. (c_: 1) a_^(b_: 0) :> (c a^b)^2) &, 66] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Sep 29 2019, after _Bill Gosper_ at A007913 *)
xref: Cf. A082473 (gives the terms in ascending order, with duplicates removed).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 28 2019
